intro: Cnicus intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate sowthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features lobed, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Its botanical characteristics include a taproot system and a preference for disturbed soils. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions.
